gov.nasa.ial.mde.sound
Class Sounder

java.lang.Object
  gov.nasa.ial.mde.sound.MultiWavePlayer
      gov.nasa.ial.mde.sound.Sounder

public class Sounder
extends MultiWavePlayer

Class to generate the audio used to sonify data or equations in the form of AnalyzedItems in a Solver. Currently, we support a maximum of MAX_FREQUENCIES=10 simultaneous tones, and if the Solver happens to generate more than Sounder.MAX_FREQUENCIES simultaneous tones, the behavior is not defined.

Since:
1.0
Version:
1.0
Author:
Dr. Robert Shelton

Constructor Detail

Sounder

public Sounder(Solver solver,
               MdeSettings settings)
Instantiates a Sounder for a particular Solver and MDE configuration.

Parameters:
solver - The Solver containing the AnalyzedItems to be sonified
settings - Controls how the AnalyzedItems in the Solver will be rendered
Method Detail

sweep

public void sweep(double sweepTimeInSeconds)
Performs a sonification sweep for all sonifiable data represented in this.solver

Parameters:
sweepTimeInSeconds - is the desired duration of the sweep.

updateSettings

public void updateSettings(MdeSettings mdeSettings)
Updates all sonification settings including waveform and indicators for axis crossing and negative values.

Parameters:
mdeSettings - the sonification settings to be used.

render

public void render(double x,
                   double y)
Sonify the specified single point.

Parameters:
x - the x value
y - the y value

render

public void render(double position)
Sonify the relative position [0,1] for all the solutions in the solver.

Parameters:
position - the relative position [0,1] in the array of points to render. Note that this assumes that the data points are sorted and equally spaced in x.

isUsingAlteredWaveform

public boolean isUsingAlteredWaveform()
Returns the state of altered (fuzzified) waveform sonification.

Returns:
True whenever sonification uses an altered (fuzzified) waveform to indicate negative y values.

setUsingAlteredWaveform

public void setUsingAlteredWaveform(boolean usingAlteredWaveform)
Enables altered (fuzzed) waveform sonification.

Parameters:
usingAlteredWaveform - The value indicating whether or not negative values of y are to be sonified with an altered (fuzzed) waveform.

isUsingChirp

public boolean isUsingChirp()
Returns the state of the X-axis crossing chirp flag.

Returns:
True whenever chirps are present to indicate X-axis crossings.

setUsingChirp

public void setUsingChirp(boolean usingChirp)
Enables the X-axis crossings chirp flag.

Parameters:
usingChirp - Determines whether X-axis crossings will be indicated with chirps.

isUsingDing

public boolean isUsingDing()
Returns the state of the Ding flag.

Returns:
True whenever a ding will indicate the trace crossing the Y-axis.

setUsingDing

public void setUsingDing(boolean usingDing)
Enables the X-axis crosing chirp flag.

Parameters:
usingDing - Determines whether the trace crossing the X-axis is indicated with a ding.

isUsingHiss

public boolean isUsingHiss()
Returns the state of the Hiss flag.

Returns:
True whenever a hiss is used to indicate negative y values.

setUsingHiss

public void setUsingHiss(boolean usingHiss)
Enables the hiss sonification for negative y values.

Parameters:
usingHiss - Determines whether negative y values will be indicated with a hiss.
